    • Reporting statistical result from a 2-sample t-test

Data on species richness in constructed wetlands at Pennsylvania Game Lands 297 in south western PA.

Data are the number of species observed in a 0.25 m^2 plot. The original data include the number of stems and percentage cover of each species within the sampling plot. Data collected by Gerry Koza (koz7133@calu.edu) in the summer 2017.

wetlands

Format

A data frame with 78 rows and 5 variables:

site

Gameland

wetland

Wetland number. Can be 1 2 or3

Plot

Transect an plot designations

water.depth

depth of water within sapling plot

spp.richness

The number of species observed within the sampling plot

Examples

data(wetlands)

library(ggplot2)
library(ggpubr)

## Species richness versus water depth
ggscatter(data = wetlands,
         y = "spp.richness",
         x = "water.depth")

## Species richness by wetland
### Note that dataframe is "wetlands" with an "s"
### and the column name is "wetland", no "s"

ggerrorplot(wetlands,
y = "spp.richness",
x = "wetland",
desc_stat = "mean_ci",
error.plot = "errorbar",
add = "mean")
